controller

Class VHSController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.VHSController

  • public class VHSController
extends java.lang.Object
    VHSController is responsible for connecting listeners in VHS.fxml to variables in VHSCollection. VHSController is also responsible for updating the VHS.txt file to be used for VHS.fxml's TableView.
    Author:
    Jesus Nieto

    • Constructor Detail

      • VHSController

        public VHSController()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        initialize initializes the cells in the TableView to their respective variables in the VHSCollection. initialize also pre-populates the TableView with the data in VHS.txt.

      • backButtonHandle

        public void backButtonHandle()
        backButtonHandle is responsible for returning to Collectibase's main screen and saves any new entered information to VHS.txt before exiting.

      • updateButtonHandle

        public void updateButtonHandle()
        updateButtonHandle is responsible for updating the TableView and VHS.txt whenever pressed.

      • insertButtonHandle

        public void insertButtonHandle()
        8 insertButtonHandle is responsible for inserting any text in the text fields onto the TableView. Empty fields are also accounted for. After the fields have been inserted they are cleared and VHS.txt is updated.

      • deleteButtonHandle

        public void deleteButtonHandle()
        deleteButtonHandle deletes a selected field or row from the TableView. VHS.txt is also updated by deleting the respective fields from the file.

      • cellValueFactory

        public void cellValueFactory()
        cellValueFactory is responsible for connecting the variable columns with it's respective variable in VHSCollection. cellValueFactory also allows for a single cell to be edited when double clicked.

      • changeTitleName

        public void changeTitleName(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<VHSCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)
        The methods below update a single variable of a collectible when it's cell is double clicked.
        Parameters:
        edditedCell: - the cell that was edited in VHS.fxml's TableView will be the variable that is changed in VHSCollection.

      • changeGenre

        public void changeGenre(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<VHSCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell1)

      • changeFormat

        public void changeFormat(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<VHSCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeYear

        public void changeYear(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<VHSCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

        public void changeDirector(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<VHSCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeSpecialEdition

        public void changeSpecialEdition(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<VHSCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeHomeRecordings

        public void changeHomeRecordings(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<VHSCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeMultiProgram

        public void changeMultiProgram(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<VHSCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeMultiTape

        public void changeMultiTape(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<VHSCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeSleeveType

        public void changeSleeveType(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<VHSCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • writeVHSFile

        public void writeVHSFile()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        writeVHSFile is responsible for writing to VHS.txt in order to update VHS.fxml's TableView.
        Throws:
        Exception: - In case that the collection has not been previously created, the vhs.txt file is not found.
        java.lang.Exception
